title: Drawing, "Design for a Teapot", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, graphite, on verso, white and yellow pastel on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp: in black ink at lower right: 45 [smeared]
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and balck ink at lower center: THEIERE (C)/DIAMETRE 12 cms/HAUTEUR 12 cms 75; at lower right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/10-41.
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Pear-shaped teapot with flared spout drawn in elevation with an applied scalloped-edged lower body indicated in yellow pastel to be executed in vermeil. Hinged lid surmounted by a short stem-form finial and attached C-scroll handle indicated in white pastel to be executed in ivory. Raised on a short flaring foot. Placement of screws and hinge indicated by circles on lid and upper handle. Underdrawing in graphite of teapot in golden section.
Puiforcat collection contains two archival photographs of coffeepot from same tea service, Box 8, Folder 1 "Coffeepots," #44.
Puiforcat Fabrication #: 45.
